intro: Bulbostylis pseudoperennis, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist soil conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
